docs.lead_paragraph: IBM says former Weather Co. CEO David Kenny will be the new boss for Watson, the Jeopardy-winning "cognitive computing" service that's a central element of CEO Virginia Rometty's campaign to find new revenue for the struggling tech giant.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Rep. Frank Guinta has repaid $355,000 he was accused of illegally accepting from his parents in 2010, and on Friday he emphasized his more recent accomplishments as he officially began his re-election effort.

docs.lead_paragraph: House Democrats said Friday they have a clear election-year message — low unemployment, health insurance for millions and dropping gas prices — as they face steep odds of reclaiming the majority that delivered President Barack Obama his greatest first-term legislative victories.

docs.lead_paragraph: The lab, in Newark, Calif, was cited on Monday by federal regulators for violations of clinical standards.

headline.main: Walgreens Says No Customers’ Tests Will Be Done at Theranos Lab in California
headline.print_headline: Walgreens Suspends Tests of Blood by Theranos Lab

docs.abstract: Walgreens suspends blood tests by Theranos laboratories; reliability of labs' testing has been questioned, and regulators have discovered violations.
docs.snippet: The lab, in Newark, Calif, was cited on Monday by federal regulators for violations of clinical standards.

docs.lead_paragraph: As alarm grows over Zika, airlines are allowing passengers to change flights or receive refunds, and some tour companies are seeing cancellations.

headline.main: How the Zika Virus Is Affecting Travel
headline.print_headline: As Zika Concerns Grow, the Travel Industry Reacts

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warnings against travel to areas affected by Zika virus, particularly for pregnant women or those planning a pregnancy, are bringing reactions across travel industry; number of airlines have issued statements concerning their rebooking and refund policies for travelers with reservations to impacted areas, and cruise lines are also working with customers who want to postpone or cancel travel.
docs.snippet: As alarm grows over Zika, airlines are allowing passengers to change flights or receive refunds, and some tour companies are seeing cancellations.
